intro: Plagiobothrys foliosus, commonly known as the leafy plains centaury, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stems. Plagiobothrys foliosus is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils.
